MLApp package¶

This is the machine learning and Blender portion of the app.

  • Machine Learning Functionality

    • Custom Neural Net

    • Material Generation

Machine Learning Functionality¶

Custom Neural Net¶

class MLApp.custom_torch.custom_net.CustomNet(layers_dict)[source]¶

Bases: Module

Simple neural net that currently supports nn.Linear, nn.Conv2d and nn.MaxPool2d, nn.ReLU and nn.Sigmoid layers.

__init__(self, layers_dict) Runs each layer in layers_dict through a switch statement, appending the corresponding layer to self.layers

props: layers_dict (for __init__)

forward(x)[source]¶

Returns tensor representing estimated material parameters.

Material Generation¶

MLApp.custom_torch.flask_generate_material.flask_generate_material(test_form, upload_folder)[source]¶

Runs a forward pass of the model then compares then returns the parameters as json.

test_sizeint

Allows for a subset of specific size to be tested, will also allow the image or image path itself to be returned.

Training¶

MLApp.custom_torch.flask_train.flask_train(training_form)[source]¶

Simple training loop using parameters from the training_form, saves a checkpoint.

Image Dataset¶

class MLApp.custom_torch.image_dataset.ImageDataset(root, targets, transform=None, target_transform=None)[source]¶

Bases: VisionDataset

Ineherits Torch’s datasets.VisionDataset.

targets¶

List of materials, each is composed of a list of floats.

Type:

list

image_dir¶

Path to image directory.

Type:

str

Target Loader¶

MLApp.custom_torch.target_loader.target_loader(directory)[source]¶

Loads material properties from JSON files.

targets_jsonlist

List of raw JSON.

targetslist

List of materials, each is a list of floats representing material parameters.

MLApp.parameters module¶

Contains all constants and paths.

import os
import torch
import torch.optim as optim
from torch import nn

"""Contains all constants and paths.
"""
BATCH_SIZE = 20
EPOCHS = 1
LEARNING_RATE = 0.01
TRAINING_SET_SIZE = 5000
VALIDATION_SET_SIZE = 1500
TEST_SET_SIZE = 1500
loss_function = nn.L1Loss()
DATABASE_PATH = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), "MLApp", "data", "data.db")

OPTIMIZER = optim.Adam

blender_executable = r"C:\Program Files\Blender Foundation\Blender 3.4\blender.exe"
train_dir = os.path.join("data", "train")
val_dir = os.path.join("data", "val")
test_dir = os.path.join("data", "test")
#render_data_script = "\\blender_scripts\\render_data.py"
render_data_script = os.path.join("blender_scripts", "render_data.py")
device = (
    "cuda"
    if torch.cuda.is_available()
    else "mps"
    if torch.backends.mps.is_available()
    else "cpu"
)

state_dict_dir = os.path.join("data", "w_and_b")
state_dict_path = os.path.join("data", "w_and_b", "model_checkpoint2.pth")

Blender Scripts¶

Blender Launcher¶

MLApp.blender_scripts.blender_launcher.launch_blender(data='train', script='', scene_props='', render_dir='')[source]¶

Simple function to launch blender passing in data_dir and a script as argv.

data_dirstr

Location of the directory containing material parameters.

scriptstr

Location of the script to run in Blender on launch.

Render Scripts¶

MLApp.blender_scripts.render_data.render_loop(obj, env_node, mat_nodes, scene_path, render_path, scene_props)[source]¶

Iterates through the material props object, applying the props to the current material then rendering the scene. It saves the file then moves on to the next set of props.

MLApp.blender_scripts.render_data.setup_scene(scene_path)[source]¶

Sets up scene variables.

Props: scene_path

Returns:

bpy.data.object - mat: bpy.data.material - mat_nodes: bpy node tree.

Return type:

  • obj
